relation: *Enable you to identify the best worker for you job *A single job description that asks for one item *Many people proposing or creating item *Only pay one person
*Enable you to get a specific skill for a job or project *Hire worker from crowd for single task *Communicate over the Internet *Worker paid by task
*Enable you to use human intelligence on large, complicated jobs *Divide big jobs into small units *Put units on the Internet *Let members of crowd do tasks *All workers get paid
*Engage social networks to raise money *Put a request for funds on an Internet platform *Create messages and videos to promote request *Recruit crowd to donate money *Offer crowd gift or benefit

*Post a challenge on the Internet *Recruit crowd to work on challenge *Crowd organises itself into a team *Teams compete to provide best answer for challenge *Winning team compensated *Team decides how to divide compensation
*Graphic design *Answering questions *Testing software *Creating films *Other creative projects
*General business work *Web design and other forms of design *Assistance with writing and editing *Application development
*Transcribe business cards, medical records and other documents *Tag photos and handle non-textual data *Find business information
*Support non-profit organisations *Raise funds for artistic endeavours *Get cash for companies by offering goods or services *Raise equity for company (under the right circumstances)
*Innovation – creating new products or services *Finding and collecting information *Processing information and offering judgement *Solving challenges
pageTitle: Understanding the Five Types of Crowdsourcing - For Dummies
textBeforeTable: Crowdsourcing has five major forms. Each form involves a crowdsourcer or manager, a crowdmarket and a crowd of people. By choosing the right form of crowdsourcing, you can manage large jobs with thousands of workers or do small jobs that require just a single person. You can create jobs that you carefully monitor and control, or you can let the crowd organise itself and decide how it should do the work. Part of the Crowdsourcing For Dummies Cheat Sheet David Alan Grier By Understanding the Five Types of Crowdsourcing } document.write('
